tweet: In addition, plans will be incentivized to drop physicians from their network and negotiate lower rates under the threat of providers getting the even lower out of network rate if they don’t sign up. Balanced billing is banned. This is happening in CA. Not in NY. Wonder why?

Plans want to pay as little as they can for a service, so of course it might cost consumers less if the plan can pay under fair market value. That’s what will happen without the option of arbitration for providers. I wouldn’t bet the farm on plans lowering rates. They won’t.

@avik read your piece from Forbes on surprise billing. The health plans couldn’t have written it better. They want a race to the reimbursement bottom for providers. For the real facts come in and talk with me. LB
